commitResults.messageBody:
Following the instructions for Week 3, Level-1 of Mong can echo commands
sent to the command line. Mong will exit the program when the user types
the command "bye".

Following the instructions for Week 3, Level-2 of Mong allows users to
add items into a list, which can be printed in index order when the
"list" command is entered.

Add items to the list: add items from the command line into a list that
displays when the command "list" is typed out.

Index items in the list: items in the list start from the number "1".

Following the instructions for Week 3, Level-3 of Mong introduces a
marking command for users to set items in the command list as completed
or uncompleted.

Create a class of ListItem: use a class to implement the adding,
indexing, marking, and unmarking of each item in the list.

The class will handle the instantiation of each ListItem and setting of
the "isCompleted" variable that is assigned to each ListItem in the
array of ListItems.
